titleInfo.title: PARTIAL-BIRTH ABORTION BAN ACT OF 1997--VETO MESSAGE FROM THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES (H. DOC. NO. 105-158)

extension.searchTitle: PARTIAL-BIRTH ABORTION BAN ACT OF 1997--VETO MESSAGE FROM THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES (H. DOC. NO. 105-158); Congressional Record Vol. 144, No. 100

congVote.result: So the motion was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House voted to override the President's veto of H.R. 1122, to amend title 18, United States Code, to ban partial-birth abortions, by a yea and nay vote of 296 yeas to 132 nays, Roll No. 325.<P/>Earlier agreed to discharge the Committee on the Judiciary from further consideration of H.R. 1122 by a yea and nay vote of 295 yeas to 131 nays, Roll No. 321.

titleInfo.title: MOTION TO INSTRUCT CONFEREES ON H.R. 3616, NATIONAL DEFENSE AUTHORIZATION ACT FOR FISCAL YEAR 1999

extension.searchTitle: MOTION TO INSTRUCT CONFEREES ON H.R. 3616, NATIONAL DEFENSE AUTHORIZATION ACT FOR FISCAL YEAR 1999; Congressional Record Vol. 144, No. 100

congVote.result: So the motion to instruct was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Agreed to the Skelton motion to instruct conferees to insist upon the authorization levels provided in title II of the House bill for Theater Missile Defense programs and for space-based lasers by a yea and nay vote of 424 yeas with none voting ``nay'' and 1 voting ``present'', Roll No. 322.

titleInfo.title: MOTION TO CLOSE CONFERENCE COMMITTEE MEETINGS WHEN CLASSIFIED NATIONAL SECURITY INFORMATION IS UNDER CONSIDERATION

extension.searchTitle: MOTION TO CLOSE CONFERENCE COMMITTEE MEETINGS WHEN CLASSIFIED NATIONAL SECURITY INFORMATION IS UNDER CONSIDERATION; Congressional Record Vol. 144, No. 100

congVote.result: So the motion was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Agreed to the Skelton motion to instruct conferees to insist upon the authorization levels provided in title II of the House bill for Theater Missile Defense programs and for space-based lasers by a yea and nay vote of 424 yeas with none voting ``nay'' and 1 voting ``present'', Roll No. 322.<P/>Subsequently, agreed to the Spence motion to close portions of the conference when classified information is under consideration, by a yea and nay vote of 412 yeas to 5 nays, Roll No. 323.

congVote.result: So, two-thirds having voted in favor thereof, the bill was passed, the objections of the President to the contrary notwithstanding.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House voted to override the President's veto of H.R. 1122, to amend title 18, United States Code, to ban partial-birth abortions, by a yea and nay vote of 296 yeas to 132 nays, Roll No. 325.

titleInfo.title: DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR AND RELATED AGENCIES APPROPRIATION ACT, 1999

extension.searchTitle: DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR AND RELATED AGENCIES APPROPRIATION ACT, 1999; Congressional Record Vol. 144, No. 100

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 4193, making appropriations for the Department of the Interior and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1999, by a yea and nay vote of 245 yeas to 181 nays, Roll No. 331.<P/>The Obey motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Appropriations with Instructions to report it back with an amendment limiting funds made available unless Representative Sidney R. Yates stands for election to the 106th Congress from the �D828�9th District of Illinois was offered and subsequently withdrawn.<P/>The DeFazio amendment that sought to strike the provision that extends the recreational fee demonstration program for another 2 years (rejected by a recorded vote of 81 ayes to 341 noes, Roll No. 326);

The House passed H.R. 4193, making appropriations for the Department of the Interior and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1999, by a yea and nay vote of 245 yeas to 181 nays, Roll No. 331.

extension.searchTitle: DEPARTMENTS OF VETERANS AFFAIRS AND HOUSING AND URBAN DEVELOPMENT, AND INDEPENDENT AGENCIES APPROPRIATIONS ACT, 1999; Congressional Record Vol. 144, No. 100

congVote.result: So the amendment was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House resumed consideration of amendments to H.R. 4194, making appropriations for the Departments of Veterans Affairs and Housing and Urban Development, and for sundry independent agencies, boards, commissions, corporations, and offices for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1999.<P/>The Obey amendment that specifies that any limitation on funding to EPA or the Council on Environmental Quality shall not apply to educational outreach or informational seminars (agreed to by a recorded vote of 226 ayes to 198 noes, Roll No. 332);

congVote.result: The CHAIRMAN. On this rollcall, 352 Members have recorded their presence by electronic device, a quorum is present, and the Committee will resume its business.

titleInfo.title: DEPARTMENTS OF COMMERCE, JUSTICE, AND STATE, THE JUDICIARY, AND RELATED AGENCIES APPROPRIATIONS ACT, 1999

extension.searchTitle: DEPARTMENTS OF COMMERCE, JUSTICE, AND STATE, THE JUDICIARY, AND RELATED AGENCIES APPROPRIATIONS ACT, 1999; Congressional Record Vol. 144, No. 100

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: <P/>By a unanimous vote of 99 yeas (Vote No. 234), Senate passed S. 2260, making appropriations for the Departments of Commerce, Justice, and State, the Judiciary, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1999, after taking action on amendments proposed thereto, as follows:<P/>By 18 yeas to 82 nays (Vote No. 228), Craig Modified Amendment No. 3268 (to Amendment No. 3266), to clarify that Indian gaming is subject to Federal jurisdiction.

<P/>By a unanimous vote of 99 yeas (Vote No. 234), Senate passed S. 2260, making appropriations for the Departments of Commerce, Justice, and State, the Judiciary, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1999, after taking action on amendments proposed thereto, as follows:<P/>By 90 yeas to 10 nays (Vote No. 229), Kyl/Bryan Amendment No. 3266, to prohibit Internet gambling.

titleInfo.title: DEPARTMENTS OF COMMERCE, JUSTICE, AND STATE, THE JUDICIARY, AND RELATED AGENCIES APPROPRIATIONS ACT, 1999

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: <P/>By a unanimous vote of 99 yeas (Vote No. 234), Senate passed S. 2260, making appropriations for the Departments of Commerce, Justice, and State, the Judiciary, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1999, after taking action on amendments proposed thereto, as follows:<P/>By 90 yeas to 10 nays (Vote No. 229), Kyl/Bryan Amendment No. 3266, to prohibit Internet gambling.<P/>Gregg (for DeWine) Amendment No. 3274, to authorize the local law enforcement block grant program.<P/>Gregg/Hollings Amendment No. 3277, relating to the delivery of digital signals in certain areas.<P/>Gregg/Hollings Amendment No. 3278, relating to the operation of a diplomatic facility in Jerusalem.<P/>Subsequently, the amendment was modified.<P/>Gregg/Hollings Amendment No. 3279, to establish a whale conservation fund.<P/>By 53 yeas to 47 nays (Vote No. 230), Nickles Amendment No. 3272, to amend certain criminal laws relating to the compensation of attorneys.<P/>Bingaman/Domenici Modified Amendment No. 3273, to prohibit from trademark the flag, coat of arms or other insignia of any federally-recognized Indian tribes.

congVote.result: The motion to lay on the table the amendment (No. 3276) was rejected.
The amendment (No. 3258), as modified, as amended, was agreed to.
The bill (S. 2260), as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: <P/>By a unanimous vote of 99 yeas (Vote No. 234), Senate passed S. 2260, making appropriations for the Departments of Commerce, Justice, and State, the Judiciary, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1999, after taking action on amendments proposed thereto, as follows:
